fr.lri.swingstates.canvas

Class CRectangularShape

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.lri.swingstates.canvas.CShape
      • fr.lri.swingstates.canvas.CRectangularShape
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CElement, GraphicalShape, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CEllipse, CRectangle, CSegment

    public abstract class CRectangularShape
extends CShape
    An abstract rectangular shape for use with an Canvas. CRectangularShape is the base class for CEllipse and CRectangle, it provides methods to manipulate those shapes by their rectangular bounding box.
    Author:
    Caroline Appert

        public CRectangularShape setBoundingBox(java.awt.geom.Point2D p1,
                               java.awt.geom.Point2D p2)
        Define this rectangular shape by its bounding box.
        Parameters:
        p1 - One corner of the diagonal of the bounding box.
        p2 - The other corner of the diagonal of the bounding box.
        Returns:
        this rectangular shape.

      • setBoundingBox

        public CRectangularShape setBoundingBox(double minx,
                               double miny,
                               double width,
                               double height)
        Define this rectangular shape by its bounding box.
        Parameters:
        minx - The x coordinate of the upper left corner of the bounding box.
        miny - The y coordinate of the upper left corner of the bounding box.
        width - The width of the bounding box.
        height - The height of the bounding box.
        Returns:
        this rectangular shape.

        Parameters:
        x1 - The x coordinate of one corner of the diagonal.

        x2 - The x coordinate of the other corner of the diagonal.

        Returns:
        this rectangle

      • setDiagonal

        public CRectangularShape setDiagonal(java.awt.geom.Point2D p1,
                            java.awt.geom.Point2D p2)
        Define this rectangular shape by its diagonal. The coordinates are relative to the untransformed geometry of the shape, i.e. it modifies the initial bounds of this shape.
        Parameters:
        p1 - One corner of the diagonal.
        p2 - The other corner of the diagonal.
        Returns:
        this ellipse
